result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Fred Thomas Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin Fred Thomas Jr. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney enters not guilty plea and matter to be set.

01:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Fred Thomas Jr. appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin Fred Thomas Jr. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:44 pM Defendant Benjamin Fred Thomas in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter Isaacson by video. David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $650.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.H.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 1PM.
